I announce the support of sampling kits, detection kits and vaccines worth USD 7.5 million," he added.PM Modi also announced that India will cooperate in radiotherapy treatment and capacity building and will contribute 40 million vaccine doses for Indo-Pacific countries under Gavi and Quad initiatives.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced 7.5 million US dollars worth of support for sampling and detection kits and vaccines to fight cervical cancer. PM Modi said India developed its vaccine for the disease and new treatment protocols are being rolled out with the help of artificial intelligence (AI)

Article Title: 'Time tested friendship': PM Modi holds bilateral talks with Australian counterpart on sidelines of Quad summit
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese held a bilateral meeting in Wilmington, Delaware on the sidelines of the Quad leaders' Summit 2024.During the meeting, PM Modi and Australian PM Antony Albanese reiterated their commitment to deepen the comprehensive strategic partnership for mutual benefit as well as for the peace, stability, and prosperity of the Indo-Pacific region."PM Narendra Modi met PM Anthony Albanese of Australia today in Wilmington, Delaware. The leaders reaffirmed their commitment to further deepen the comprehensive strategic partnership for mutual benefit as well as for the peace, stability, and prosperity of the Indo-Pacific region," the MEA said on X.In a post on X, PM Modi hailed the "time tested friendship" and said both countries seek to add momentum in areas ranging from space to culture."Held extensive discussions with PM Albanese. We seek to add even more momentum in areas like trade, security, space and culture. India greatly cherishes the time tested friendship with Australia," PM Modi said on X.After the meeting, Australian PM Anthony Albanese took to X and said it was great to talk with PM Modi and deliberate ways to strengthen India-Australia partnership."Great to talk with Prime Minister Narendra Modi today at the Quad Leaders Summit about ways to strengthen our partnership," PM Albanese said on X.The Quad leaders' Summit, held for the sixth time, marked a farewell for both US. President Joe Biden and Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida as they prepare to step down from office.Prime Minister Narendra Modi also held a bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden.The leaders focused on strengthening the India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership, with both PM Modi and President Biden stressing the strong and dynamic relationship between the two nations."The United States' partnership with India is stronger, closer, and more dynamic than any time in history. Prime Minister Modi, each time we sit down, I'm struck by our ability to find new areas of cooperation. Today was no different," Biden wrote on X after meeting with PM Modi.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese held a bilateral meeting in Wilmington, Delaware on the sidelines of the Quad leaders' Summit 2024. PM Modi hailed the "time tested friendship" and said both countries seek to add momentum in areas ranging from space to culture.

Article Title: HDFC Credila gears up for mega IPO, aims to raise Rs 5,000cr
Article Text: MUMBAI: HDFC Credila, country's largest education loan provider, is gearing up for a major initial public offering ( IPO ) in 2025, targeting to raise over Rs 5,000 crore . Backed by Swedish investment firm EQT and Indian private equity giant ChrysCapital, HDFC Credila has shortlisted investment banks.The IPO plans come on the back of strong financials , with HDFC Credila reporting a profit after tax of Rs 528.84 crore in FY24.The final amount raised through the IPO will depend on the extent of stake dilution by existing investors.Ajay and Anil Bohra, in a recent interview with TOI shared that the success of HDFC Credila validated the education loan business model in India and spawned a Rs 1 lakh crore industry, with several former HDFC Credila team members either setting up their own education loan ventures or leading similar verticals at other institutions.
Article Summary: HDFC Credila is gearing up for a major initial public offering ( IPO ) in 2025. Backed by Swedish investment firm EQT and Indian private equity giant ChrysCapital. The final amount raised through the IPO will depend on the extent of stake dilution by existing investors.

Article Title: In letter to Centre, IIT-Kharagpur professors flag 'unprecedented nepotism'
Article Text: KOLKATA: IIT-Kharagpur Teachers' Association has written to the human resource development minister Friday, alleging that in the past five years, the institute has witnessed "unprecedented nepotism ", causing "serious damage to the institute's reputation". The letter assumes significance as the institute is poised to get a new director from Jan 2025.The association has urged the minister to select a new director of "high academic repute and experience in practising inclusive governance".The letter stated: "...we are stunned to see the rise of a particular person, belonging to the same department as the incumbent director, from professor position to the head of the department, member of board of governors, dean, SRIC and now the deputy director of the Institute. This is now the talk of the town as how favouritism has flourished in the tenure of the current director..."The association also pointed out that selection of key administrative positions has been done whimsically, flouting all rules. It further alleged that "arbitrariness and vindictiveness" in the faculty selection process caused several existing faculty members to leave the institute.Despite good academic performance, many young faculty members were allegedly made to wait for more than a year on probation for "unknown or silly reasons", the association said in the letter, claiming that the present director failed to start the multi-speciality hospital on the IIT premises and the campus in Malaysia.In an official statement, IIT-Kgp refuted all allegations, claiming that a panel comprising a qualified "cadre of people" takes "collective decision on the recruitment process, irrespective of any influence from individual capacity". The institute claimed that these allegations were levelled to malign IIT Kharagpur out of "malicious personal vendetta against the concerned individual", and added that it wouldn't endorse the "act of slander" against senior employees.
Article Summary: IIT-Kharagpur Teachers' Association has written to the human resource development minister. It alleges that in the past five years, the institute has witnessed "unprecedented nepotism" The letter assumes significance as the institute is poised to get a new director from Jan 2025.

Article Title: 7 students held for assault on Major in Odisha get bail
Article Text: Bhubaneswar: Odisha police on Saturday arrested seven engineering students detained a day earlier for assaulting an Army officer and his fiancee on Sept 15.The students were booked under bailable sections like voluntarily causing hurt and obscene act of the BNS, and were granted bail by a lower court in the evening.
Article Summary: The students were booked under bailable sections like voluntarily causing hurt and obscene act of the BNS. They were granted bail by a lower court in the evening. The students were detained a day earlier for assaulting an Army officer and his fiancee on Sept 15.

Article Title: Expanding Air India's punctuality woes leave flyers frustrated
Article Text: NEW DELHI: "Set your watches boys, we are right on schedule." A beaming J R D Tata had remarked when Air India 's (AI) maiden international flight, which left Bombay on June 8, 1948, for London via Cairo and Geneva, reached its destination the next day. That's folklore for AI passengers now, especially those taking its USP medium to ultra long hauls, due to frequent long delays.While nobody expected miracles within two-and-a-half years of the airline returning to founder Tata Group in Jan 2022 after nearly seven decades as a PSU, AI's poor on time performance (OTP) is now irking and inconveniencing passengers who prefer not to look at their watches on delayed flights.Vistara, which was more punctual, will be merged into AI on Nov 12.Sample this: On Aug 31, 2024, Mumbai-London AI 129 left nearly nine hours after its scheduled departure time of 5.15am. The same day, Mumbai-New York (JFK) left after a 12-hour delay. AI 129, flight tracking sites show, left after 2pm on Aug 28, 29 and 30. And on Aug 23 and 24, it left after 8am. The list of delays is an endless one. A flight operating within 15 minutes of its scheduled departure/arrival time is considered on time.AI's domestic punctuality is also in the pits. Only struggling-to-survive SpiceJet and Alliance Air have seen worse OTP than it in recent months, as per DGCA data (see box). But passengers have options on domestic routes. AI's domestic market share in CY 2023 was 9.7%. International, however, is another story. AI offers the maximum medium to ultra long haul nonstops to North America, Europe, Far East and Australia.On many routes like Delhi-Chicago/San Francisco (SFO)/Washington; Mumbai-New York/SFO and Bengaluru-SFO, AI is the only direct service. For North America, AI direct flights are the fastest option as the airline overflies Russia and takes the shortest route. Delay of these flights is testing the patience of the loyal customer base of diaspora and Indian globetrotters that are so crucial for the airline.According to OAG, the top three airlines for international capacity share from India in April 2024 were Air India (20%), IndiGo (17%) and Emirates (7%).Comments were sought from AI on its international flight delays - why they are happening with such regularity and what is being about the same - and were awaited till the time of going to press.Recently, DGCA had to intervene after three back-to-back really long delays this summer: Mumbai-SFO AI 179 of May 24 by 18 hours; Delhi-SFO of May 30 by over 30 hours and June 1 Delhi-Vancouver by over 20 hours. "AI is time and again failing in taking due care of passengers," the DGCA notice at that time said. DGCA does not give OTP figures for international flights.TOI spoke to a cross section of stakeholders to find out the reason for AI's poor performance. The common reasons - engineering and maintenance issues that are leading to poor technical dispatch reliability; frequent grounding of aircraft due to snags; spare shortage and poor crew planning."In this backdrop, AI has bitten off more than it can chew in terms of having so many flights which it cannot operate without frequent delays or seeing cancellations. They are over-sweating the planes," said sources. AI has both added a number of international flights.Multiple stakeholders spoke about a management disconnect with the ground realities and the new managers not taking the legacy team along. "They have antagonised the old key employees and keep criticising them. So many long-time employees now feel disconnected. Everything is on multiple apps and emails. If something is to be reported, do so by email. A reply may come a few days later," said multiple people.Even AI insiders admit that these issues will not get resolved just by inducting new aircraft. AI Engineering Services Ltd (AIESL) was hived off when AI was privatised. "Systems and processes have to be in place. Our long hauls operate on the edge of the maximum carrying capacity and limit of aircraft. Even a small issue means leaving passengers or baggage behind; delaying or cancelling flights. Bombay House (Tata HQ) is seized of the matter; is watching the situation closely and is asking the questions that need to be asked," they said.
Article Summary: Air India's poor on time performance (OTP) is now irking and inconveniencing passengers. Only struggling-to-survive SpiceJet and Alliance Air have seen worse OTP than it in recent months. Vistara, which was more punctual, will be merged into AI on Nov 12.

Article Title: NHAI makes online report-&-rectify portal a round-the-year drill
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Facing flak over increased instances of damaged stretches, potholes and deformed road signs, NHAI has made its online system of reporting problems and recording their rectification a round-the-year exercise by making contractors accountable, reports Dipak Dash. Recently, it carried out a two-week long special drive for inspection of 37,000 km of NHs and found 12,795 defects, including potholes and damaged stretches, crash barriers and signage.While nearly 68% (8,900) of these have been rectified so far, in several cases NHAI is imposing fines on contractors.A top NHAI official said they used an in-house mobile app to get the exact status of roads and progress of repair, and also for holding the contractors responsible for poor maintenance. NHAI has decided to take the personnel deployed in highway patrol vans to record and report any damage to highway stretches or other issues through the app for quick action ."Once a defect is reported, an instant notification is sent to the contractor's team through the app. They can view the defect location, photo, and any additional remarks. Each defect has a live countdown timer based on its contractual rectification timeline. After contractors reported rectification, these are verified before closing them," the official said.
Article Summary: Facing flak over increased instances of damaged stretches, potholes and deformed road signs, NHAI has made its online system of reporting problems a round-the- year exercise. Recently, it carried out a two-week long special drive for inspection of 37,000 km of NHs and found 12,795 defects.

Article Title: Crowd protests BMC action against Dharavi mosque in Mumbai
Article Text:
( Inputs by Mateen Hafeez and Clara Lewis)

MUMBAI: Tensions rose in Dharavi after a large number of residents gathered on streets to protest against BMC's move to demolish unauthorised construction at the Subhani mosque on the 90 ft road, forcing the civic team to discontinue the action on Saturday, reports Sanjeev Devasia. Police registered a case after stones were pelted at a BMC vehicle.A large crowd gathered to protest the action at around 9 am.Subsequently, according to BMC, after mosque's trustees sought a period of four to five days to remove the encroached construction on their own, BMC gave them that deadline. According to BMC, an eviction notice was earlier served and action was initiated as per the notice.The G-North ward had initiated action to carry out demolition of unauthorised parts of the mosque twice this year, the latest on Sept 5, but the action was stopped at the last moment on both occasions. Action was stopped in Jan due to instructions from top authorities.Political activists questioned BMC action and claimed some repairs have been carried out for the safety of the structure and BMC has no right to now demolish the structure as Dharavi redevelopment project has come into being and the mosque had a photo pass. "Police were not prepared, and told us the situation could slip out of hands and result in violence," said a BMC official.
Article Summary: A large number of residents gathered on streets to protest against BMC's move to demolish unauthorised construction at the Subhani mosque. Police registered a case after stones were pelted at a BMC vehicle. According to BMC, an eviction notice was earlier served and action was initiated.

Article Title: Fair reporting ensures judges remain in bounds of law: HC
Article Text: CHANDIGARH: While closing a contempt case against the editor and reporter of an English daily, Punjab and Haryana high court has held fair reporting of court judgments "fosters freedom of press " and is an "inseparable part of administration of justice" that ensures judges remain within the bounds of law.HC was also of the view that prima facie a publisher or reporter cannot be held liable for criminal contempt even if a fair report of a court order results in the judge being personally attacked or scandalised.HC said the press, print or electronic, "are angels on guard not only vis-a-vis brazen and arbitrary state action but also are angels on guard vis-a-vis verdicts of the court of law, omitting to derogate from the settled principles of law, and well-established procedure, whereby the administration of justice rather may become defiled (sic)," HC held.The matter reached HC in the wake of a petition filed by Punjab and Haryana HC bar association against the editor-in-chief and reporter seeking criminal contempt proceedings against them for carrying a news report on May 24, 2014 titled "HC grants bail to absconding Haryana duo against rules".The bench held that in this case, before filing a criminal contempt of court petition, the consent of the advocate general was not taken, which was mandatory because the contempt proceedings were not initiated suo motu.
Article Summary: Punjab and Haryana high court has held fair reporting of court judgments "fosters freedom of press" The court said a publisher or reporter cannot be held liable for criminal contempt even if a fair report of a court order results in the judge being personally attacked or scandalised.

Article Title: NHRC seeks report from govt over EY CA's death
Article Text:
Rahul assures Anna’s parents of help

NEW DELHI: Taking cognsance of media reports pertaining to the death of a 26-year-old CA from Kerala allegedly due to "excessive workload in Ernst & Young", NHRC has issued a notice to the ministry of labour and employment, calling for a detailed report in the matter.Noting that ministry is already carrying out probe in the matter, NHRC said it would also like to know the outcome of the same.NHRC has also sought to know within four weeks what steps are being taken and are proposed to be taken to ensure such incidents don't recur. tnn Rahul Gandhi on Saturday spoke with the parents of Anna Sebastian Perayil, who died due to alleged extreme work pressure at EY, and assured them that he will fight for the cause of improving working conditions for the millions of professionals inIndia and raise the issue in Parliament.
Article Summary: NHRC has issued a notice to the ministry of labour and employment, calling for a detailed report in the matter. Rahul Gandhi on Saturday spoke with the parents of Anna Sebastian Perayil, who died due to alleged extreme work pressure at EY. Rahul assured them that he will fight for the cause of improving working conditions for the millions of professionals inIndia.

Article Title: BJP, Congress intensify war of words as PM Modi visits US
Article Text:
Posters attacking PM creations of ‘Anti-India hate shop’, tied to Rahul’s recent US trip: Trivedi

BJP spreading lies, says Rahul, stands by his remarks on Sikhs

With posters attacking PM Narendra Modi circulating in the US on the day he reached there, BJP attacked Rahul Gandhi for the campaign linking it to leader of opposition's recent visit to the country.Dubbing the posters as creations of "anti-India hate shop", BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said, "There is suspicion among Indians that if it is an outcome of Rahul Gandhi's warm meetings with the established and sponsored anti-India groups there as he has returned from the US only a few days back.Or is it the same group which was facilitating meetings of these pawns of anti-India forces with Rahul Gandhi," he said in a statement.The poster, shared by BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya on X, reads, "Protest: Modi, You're Not Welcome in New York" and calls on people to "raise your voice against a decade of oppression." A demonstration is planned for Sunday, September 22, at the Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum in Long Island.Trivedi said what is painful about the "low blow" from this "nafrat ki dukan" (hate shop) is that it is directed at a Prime Minister who took India to among the five top economies from 'Fragile Five', lifted over 26 crore people out of extreme poverty, turned the country into a pioneer in digital revolution and strengthened its internal and external security. The frustration arising from India's growing power and acceptance is born out of jealousy and nervousness, Trivedi said. "This is an objectionable poster," Trivedi said. "It is a hate advertisement and it is beyond doubt that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi got the meeting and support of those forces who are declared enemies of India..."Malviya said Gandhi's overseas engagements have consistently been detrimental to India's image. "Every time Rahul Gandhi goes abroad, he indulges in the most divisive anti-India politics, including hobnobbing with agencies and collaborating with forces inimical to India's interest. He has gone to the extent of pleading with western powers to interfere in Indian politics."Leader of opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi justified his recent remarks in the US that the "fight" in India is not about politics but whether a Sikh is allowed to wear turban and kada, and can visit gurdwara and all are free to practice their religion without fear.His post on X, an assertion that he does not regret his remarks, came after the BJP cited a joint statement of various Sikh groups to ask Rahul to withdraw his statement.Rahul said, "The BJP has been spreading lies about my remarks in America. I want to ask every Sikh brother and sister in India and abroad - is there anything wrong in what I have said? Shouldn't India be a country where every Sikh - and every Indian - can freely practice their religion without fear?"He added, "They are desperate to silence me because they cannot stand the truth... but I will always speak up for the values that define India: our unity in diversity, equality, and love."At a gathering of Indian-Americans in Herndon, a Virginia suburb of Washington DC, Gandhi recently said, "first of all, you have to understand what the fight is about. The fight is not about politics. That is superficial." In the clip, Gandhi then asked a Sikh man sitting among the audience: "what is your name, brother with the turban?"After the man shared his name, Gandhi said: "The fight is about whether he, as a Sikh, is going to be allowed to wear his turban in India or he, as a Sikh, is going to be allowed to wear a 'kada' in India. Or he, as a Sikh, is going to be able to go to a gurdwara. That's what the fight is about. And not just for him, for all religions"."And what the RSS is basically saying is that certain states are inferior to other states, certain languages are inferior to other languages, certain religions are inferior to other religions and certain communities are inferior to other communities. This is what the fight is about," Gandhi added.
Article Summary: Posters attacking PM Narendra Modi circulating in the US on the day he reached there. BJP attacked Rahul Gandhi for the campaign linking it to leader of opposition's recent visit to the country. A demonstration is planned for Sunday, September 22, at the Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum.

Article Title: Quad Summit: 'Quad is here to stay,' says PM Modi as India prepares to host 2025 summit
Article Text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi , at the Quad Summit in Wilmington on Saturday, emphasized the importance of the Quad alliance in an increasingly volatile global landscape, marked by tensions and conflicts.In his opening remarks, while speaking alongside President Biden, Australian prime minister Anthony Albanese, and Japanese prime minister Fumio Kishida, PM Modi highlighted the progress made by the Quad countries—India, the United States, Australia, and Japan—since the inaugural summit in 2021 under the leadership of US President Joe Biden "It gives me immense pleasure to participate at this Quad Summit during my third term...Under your leadership, the first summit (Quad) of 2021 was organised. In such a short time, we have expanded our cooperation in an unprecedented way in every direction,” PM Modi said.“You have played a very important role in this. I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your strong commitment and contribution to Quad," he added.The Prime Minister made clear that the Quad is united in its efforts to ensure a free, open, inclusive, and prosperous Indo-Pacific region, which remains a shared priority among the member nations."Quad Summit is taking place at a time when the world is surrounded by tensions and conflicts. In such a situation, the Quad's working together on the basis of shared democratic values is very important for the entire humanity,” said PM Modi.“We are not against anyone. We all support rules-based international order, respect for sovereignty and territorial integrity, and peaceful resolution of all issues. Free, open, inclusive and prosperous Indo-Pacific is our shared priority and shared commitment," he added."Our message is clear- the Quad is here to stay, to assist, to partner and to complement. I once again greet President Biden and all my colleagues. We will be happy to organize the Quad Leaders Summit in India in 2025," he added, expressing India’s readiness to host the next Quad Summit in 2025.The summit, hosted by US President Joe Biden in Wilmington, Delaware, saw PM Modi reaffirm that the Quad’s mission is to uphold a rules-based international order and support the principles of sovereignty and territorial integrity, stressing that it is not formed against any specific country.Ahead of the Quad Summit, PM Modi held a bilateral meeting with President Biden, where both leaders discussed strengthening the India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership .PM Modi's US visit includes an address at the UN General Assembly’s "Summit of the Future" and meetings with influential American business leaders and the Indian diaspora.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke at the Quad Summit in Wilmington, Delaware on Saturday. He emphasized the importance of the Quad alliance in an increasingly volatile global landscape, marked by tensions and conflicts. PM Modi reaffirmed that the Quad’s mission is to uphold a rules-based international order and support the principles of sovereignty.

Article Title: Narendra Modi: 'Struck by our ability to find new areas of cooperation': President Biden after holding bilateral talks with PM Modi in Delaware
Article Text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met US President Joe Biden on Saturday in Greenville, Delaware, during a bilateral meeting held on the sidelines of the Quad Summit .The leaders are focused on strengthening the India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership, with both PM Modi and President Biden emphasising the strong and dynamic relationship between the two nations.In a post on X (formerly Twitter), President Biden emphasised the significance of the relationship, saying, "The United States' partnership with India is stronger, closer, and more dynamic than any time in history.Prime Minister Modi, each time we sit down, I'm struck by our ability to find new areas of cooperation. Today was no different."PM Modi was warmly received at Biden's residence, where the two leaders shared a handshake and embraced before their bilateral meeting."A special start to a significant visit. @POTUS @JoeBiden warmly received PM @narendramodi at his residence in Greenville, Delaware," the prime minister's office said in a post on X.Prime minister Modi, in his departure statement from New Delhi, had expressed his intent to further enhance ties with the US, he said, "My meeting with President Biden will allow us to review and identify new pathways to deepen the India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership for the benefit of our people and the global good."The meeting also addressed global issues, including the ongoing war in Ukraine. National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan indicated that the conflict could be a significant topic of discussion, particularly in light of PM Modi’s recent visit to Kyiv.Prime minister Modi was accompanied by external affairs minister S. Jaishankar, foreign secretary Vikram Misri, and Indian ambassador to the US Vinay Mohan Kwatra.The US delegation included Secretary of State Antony Blinken, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan, and US Ambassador to India Eric Garcetti.As part of his three-day visit to the US, PM Modi will also hold bilateral meetings with Australian prime minister Anthony Albanese and Japanese prime minister Fumio Kishida, who are also attending the Quad Summit.The Quad, a strategic partnership between India, the US, Australia, and Japan, aims to promote peace and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific region.In addition to the summit, the Quad leaders are expected to launch a significant initiative to address cancer care and explore peaceful solutions to ongoing global conflicts, including those in Ukraine and Gaza.During his visit, Prime minister Modi will also address the Indian community in Long Island and participate in a roundtable with leading American CEOs focused on advanced technologies like AI and quantum computing.From Wilmington, PM Modi will travel to New York to attend the "Summit of the Future" at the UN General Assembly, focusing on global development and security.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met US President Joe Biden on Saturday in Greenville, Delaware, during a bilateral meeting. The leaders are focused on strengthening the India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership. The meeting also addressed global issues, including the ongoing war in Ukraine. PM Modi will travel to New York to attend the "Summit of the Future" at the UN General Assembly.

Article Title: Bangladesh's Yunus unlikely to meet PM Modi in New York
Article Text: DHAKA: Chief adviser to the Bangladesh interim govt Muhammad Yunus is scheduled to arrive in New York on Sept 23 to attend the 79th United Nations General Assembly ( UNGA ) but there a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the sidelines seems very unlikely.When asked, foreign ministry adviser Mohammed Touhid Hossain said on Saturday it appeared there was no possibility as Modi was going there a bit early while Yunus was going there a bit late.Hossain, however, said Yunus would have a bilateral meeting with external affairs minister S Jaishankar on the UNGA sidelines.Modi embarked on a three-day visit on Saturday to the US to participate in the Quad Summit being hosted by US President Joe Biden in Wilmington, and to address the Summit of the Future at the UNGA in New York.Yunus will have meetings with the PMs of the Netherlands, Pakistan, and Nepal, and the European Union president, US secretary of state, UN Secretary-General, UN human rights chief, World Bank president, and USAID administrator, Hossain said.In fact, he said, many meeting decisions are made at the last minute during this time. "New meetings may be added to that consideration; again, due to lack of time, any meeting may be omitted."
Article Summary: Muhammad Yunus is scheduled to arrive in New York on Sept 23 to attend the 79th United Nations General Assembly. There a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the sidelines seems very unlikely. Yunus will have meetings with the PMs of the Netherlands, Pakistan, and Nepal, and the European Union president.

Article Title: Forces corner Pakistan terrorists in Kishtwar gunfight
Article Text: JAMMU: At least two-three suspected Pakistani terrorists were cornered in a security counteroffensive that led to a gunfight in the mountainside forests of Chatroo in Kishtwar district of Jammu division Saturday evening.Officials said no casualties have been reported so far. “Terrorists fired at security forces , leading to an exchange. At least two-three terrorists are suspected to be trapped at the site.Additional troops have been deployed to strengthen the cordon,” an official said.On Sept 13, two soldiers were killed and as many wounded in a similar gunfight in the Chatroo belt connecting Kishtwar with south Kashmir’s Anantnag district on either side of the Pir Panjal range. Between May 4 and Sept 13, J&K recorded 21 security force fatalities — 17 in Jammu zone and four in Kashmir valley.Security has been intensified in Kishtwar, Doda, Rajouri, Poonch, Kathua, and Udhampur districts, particularly in the upper reaches, following the recent surge in terrorist activities . Security measures are also tight due to the ongoing assembly elections in J&K.
Article Summary: Officials said no casualties have been reported so far. Between May 4 and Sept 13, J&K recorded 21 security force fatalities — 17 in Jammu zone and four in Kashmir valley. Security has been intensified in Kishtwar, Doda, Rajouri, Poonch, Kathua, and Udhampur districts.
